intro: Psoralea foliosa var. gazensis, commonly known as the Gazian leaf psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its native arid and semi-arid environments.
